par.text: Sodium is a silvery-white metal, soft enough to be cut with a knife. A freshly cut surface soon becomes covered with a thin layer of sodium oxide , N
and loses its metallic lustre. Sodium is a very reactive element and has to be stored in kerosene. The metal reacts violently with water to produce sodium hydroxide - NaOH - and hydrogen,
Sodium is lighter than water and floats on the surface. In air sodium burns with a bright yellow- orange flame. The element was discovered in 1807 by the English chemist Humphry Davy.
